intro: Monnina stenophylla, commonly known as narrow-leaf monnina, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other genera such as *Evening Primrose* and *Willowherb*. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Monnina stenophylla is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
